meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a coccus bacterium.
meanings.sent1: The coccic shape of the bacterium made it easily identifiable under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the coccic bacteria to understand its structure better.
meanings.sent3: The coccic bacteria threw a tiny party under the lens of the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The coccic bacteria multiplied rapidly, resembling a bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The coccic shape of the bacterium looked like a tiny ball of life.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the coccyx bone.
meanings.sent1: Her coccic injury from the fall required careful treatment by the doctor.
meanings.sent2: Sitting on hard surfaces can put pressure on the coccic bone.
meanings.sent3: The coccic bone decided to take a break and refused to support any sitting.
meanings.sent4: After the fall, her coccic bone felt like a fragile piece in her body.
meanings.sent5: The coccic bone, also known as the tailbone, is essential for balance while sitting.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to a small, round structure or object.
meanings.sent1: The coccic design of the button made it easy to press.
meanings.sent2: She admired the coccic shape of the tiny bead in her hand.
